channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Even on Jan. 7, after the Capitol attack, Donald Trump could not admit that he had lost the presidential race, denying his loss in outtakes of a video filmed the day after the riot that were played during the Jan. 6 committee hearing. https://t.co/5nmVrewwnb https://t.co/lmo2rBdIzC

The Jan. 6 committee played video of Senator Josh Hawley fleeing the mob that stormed the Capitol on Jan. 6, hours after he riled the crowd earlier with a raised fist. The committee room burst into laughter when the footage was played, @hillhulse reports. https://t.co/9bErLV70cn https://t.co/y0AoOjRCeQ

During the eighth Jan. 6 committee hearing, Rep. Liz Cheney said "the dam has begun to break," referencing the wall of silence that Trump has always erected around himself, or tried to, with threats or cajoling or flattery to people around him. https://t.co/MPWGvqKVMV https://t.co/sPdb9N9mfS

New testimony in the Jan. 6 committee hearing revealed that members of Mike Pence's secret service detail were calling to say goodbye to their families during the riot. Follow live updates: https://t.co/PjSTMHvOq9

Rep. Bennie Thompson opened Thursday's hearing of the Jan. 6 committee with a call for accountability and by laying out the case that Donald Trump chose not to act on the day of the riot. Follow live updates: https://t.co/64ylC7aWiC https://t.co/f7OSWPotNx

Rep. Liz Cheney has emerged as the lead narrator in the Jan. 6 hearings, issuing stern warnings against witness tampering and arguing that Donald Trump betrayed the Constitution out of hunger for power. https://t.co/cjNC4X7uWn https://t.co/dTvlmfmqZR

North America’s monarch butterfly has been classified as endangered by the International Union for Conservation of Nature, the world’s most comprehensive scientific authority on the status of species. The decision follows decades of falling populations. https://t.co/AYvmcDdhvk https://t.co/ec8gLmn1n8
Jonathon Heyward is the first person of color to be the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra’s music director in its 106-year history. https://t.co/WnDA6aAaoB https://t.co/Z2k8qlRMHs

Amazon said it had reached a $3.9 billion deal to acquire One Medical, a network of primary care clinics. The move is a big step in its plans to become a major player in health care. https://t.co/X4wdQkjX1p

Breaking News: President Biden tested positive for the coronavirus and is "experiencing very mild symptoms," the White House said. He is fully vaccinated and twice boosted. https://t.co/Lesn1DjELu https://t.co/e0010PkLUi

President Biden tested positive on Thursday for the coronavirus. He will isolate at the White House and "continue to carry out all of his duties fully during that time," press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said. https://t.co/wiNhIjI6p4

Ukraine has discovered new hacking techniques that Russia is using and has continued to block efforts to penetrate its computer networks since Moscow invaded the country, the U.S. Cyber Command said Wednesday. https://t.co/b7ftZpOCqb

Ukraine’s first lady, Olena Zelenska, addressed the U.S. Congress on Wednesday, asking for more weapons to defend against what she called the "Russian hunger games" killing children and ripping apart families. "Russia is destroying our people," she said. https://t.co/HOJ8Q8i6r2 https://t.co/eiY2YmTDRC

Donald Trump called a top Republican in the State Legislature in Wisconsin in recent days to lobby for a measure that would overturn his 2020 loss in the state to President Biden. https://t.co/9ePUUDM0If

A Pennsylvania man was arrested on Sunday in connection with the 1975 murder of a 19-year-old woman after the authorities identified him through a DNA sample obtained from a coffee cup at the Philadelphia International Airport. https://t.co/NaWVD9hYsS

Many areas of France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Germany and Britain were 20 degrees hotter on Tuesday than historical averages on the same date during the late 20th century. https://t.co/Aw2Co1J7eK https://t.co/vVqfaoqo0J

Though the House passed a bill that would protect same-sex marriage from potential Supreme Court reversal, more than three quarters of House Republicans opposed it and it's unclear if it can draw votes from the 10 Senate Republicans needed to move forward. https://t.co/YXvVqqPpTP https://t.co/vYhrwzvNzU

Breaking News: A bipartisan Senate group has proposed changes to the Electoral Count Act, which Donald Trump tried to exploit to overturn the election in Congress. The changes aim to guarantee a peaceful transition of power and prevent a repeat of Jan. 6. https://t.co/Mq3keAFHtW https://t.co/3n0DtzxFZu
Breaking News: A judge ordered Rudy Giuliani to testify in a criminal investigation into election interference by Donald Trump and his allies in Georgia. https://t.co/R66E54cS1Z
Dan Cox, a far-right Trump loyalist who has promoted false claims about the 2020 election, won Maryland’s Republican primary for governor. https://t.co/mNq9JXTCTn

Magnus Carlsen, the world chess champion, said he would not play in next year’s world championship, voluntarily surrendering the title he has held since he won it in 2013 at age 22.
“I am not motivated to play another match,” he said. https://t.co/jfXkxjo0OK

A sinkhole appeared in the Bronx on Monday — 58 feet long, 15 feet wide and 20 feet deep — swallowing a parked van and damaging a water main as heavy rain and high winds rolled through New York City. https://t.co/UINuE2jYHQ https://t.co/398T5PEcVt

Breaking News: London firefighters are battling to save burning homes on Britain's hottest day ever recorded. With temperatures exceeding 40 degrees Celsius, or 104 degrees Fahrenheit, the mayor called the situation "critical." https://t.co/L7Se9BfIUS

Dr. Caitlin Bernard, an Indianapolis doctor who provided abortion care to a 10-year-old rape victim, is preparing to sue Indiana Attorney General Todd Rokita for defamation after he said he would investigate her actions in the case. https://t.co/ISF2jnbo5k

With his climate plan in shreds, President Biden is debating declaring a national climate emergency. It would give him the ability to halt new oil drilling on federal lands and waters, and spend federal funds on wind, solar and other clean energy projects. https://t.co/x3fAaEP5oN
Breaking News: Sixteen Trump supporters who tried to act as electors during the 2020 election could face charges in a criminal investigation in Georgia. https://t.co/beb1nqoZgd

Breaking News: The House passed a bill that would recognize same-sex marriages at the federal level and repeal the Defense of Marriage Act that defined marriage as between a man and woman, amid fears that the Supreme Court could nullify marriage equality. https://t.co/W9WUJsYHrb

Firefighters worked to save burning homes in parts of London on Tuesday as temperatures in Britain exceeded 40 degrees Celsius, or 104 degrees Fahrenheit, the highest on record in the country. https://t.co/cvayaDXzUx https://t.co/YNm23dDovG

In 1995, Michael Cox, a Black police officer in Boston, was viciously beaten by fellow officers who mistook him for a suspect. He spent years fighting his department in court. Now, he's Boston's new police commissioner. https://t.co/5ekqG1lB0C
Jose Alba, the Harlem bodega clerk who fatally stabbed an attacker, will not face charges, the Manhattan district attorney said on Tuesday. https://t.co/JJdITDZim7

"Stop the Steal" — the movement to reinstate President Trump, has gone far beyond him, @chashomans reports in @NYTmag. Today, it is on a mission to put right-wing candidates into office, and now threatens the future of American elections. https://t.co/pivMiC7L4q

Rep. Jody Hice revealed on Monday that he had been subpoenaed in an ongoing criminal investigation by prosecutors in Georgia into election interference by Donald Trump and his allies. https://t.co/Wfi2CY0Fgy

The UK provisionally recorded its highest temperature ever. But the reading of 39.1 degrees Celsius (102.4 Fahrenheit) is likely to be beaten again as the day goes on. https://t.co/CBzlrIpbVS https://t.co/8GXvdG5rsS

President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil called dozens of foreign diplomats to the presidential palace to tell them that he believed the country’s voting systems could be rigged, a potential preview of his strategy for an election that polls say he will lose. https://t.co/IeRY8DCut6

Liza Dmytriyeva, a 4-year-old Ukrainian girl who was killed by a Russian missile strike while on a walk with her mother, was buried with her toys in her lap: A white bunny, a gray bear, a crisscrossed moose. Her mother remains unconscious after the attack. https://t.co/ttw9O7Senv https://t.co/JTFQnpAu9s

Nearly one in 10 women have endometriosis, but for many, the symptoms are dismissed.
“We all know the symptoms of a heart attack,” said one woman who suffers from the condition. “Why don’t we know the symptoms of an extremely common disease?” https://t.co/uDSLiSCSih

A home energy monitor can be a useful tool, but you don't necessarily need one to help you save big on your power bill. Here's how to tell if installing a monitor is the right decision for you, according to the experts at @wirecutter. https://t.co/rfkKvel2S3

The board of the Pulitzer Prizes on Monday rejected an appeal by Donald Trump to rescind a prize given to The New York Times and The Washington Post for coverage of Russian interference in the 2016 election and Russian ties to Trump’s campaign. https://t.co/qnUuJwnZ0y
This summer, cook cucumbers on an outdoor grill, Yotam Ottolenghi suggests in @NYTmag. Grilling cucumbers gives them a nice charred flavor while retaining their bite. https://t.co/3n7MCsiepa

Trump Media’s $300 million fund-raising deal was said to have leaked months early to a Miami investment firm. Federal authorities are investigating a surge in trading that preceded the announcement of the deal. https://t.co/7wERAjNmyP
Dr. Anthony Fauci, who is 81 and has been a government scientist for more than 50 years, said he plans to retire by January 2025, the end of President Biden’s current term. https://t.co/aOLgwFwsYz

Surgical procedures and medication for miscarriages are identical to those for abortion. Since the end of Roe v. Wade, some patients have reported delayed or denied miscarriage care because doctors and pharmacists fear running afoul of abortion bans. https://t.co/nnpbg666HY

There are dozens of wildfires across Europe, including France and Spain. They are driven by a heat wave that has gripped parts of the continent and threatens to bring record-breaking temperatures to Britain early next week. https://t.co/wvCSz99p0v https://t.co/Ig8ZuQKB5w

The changing of the guard ceremony at Buckingham Palace on Monday was shortened because of the heat wave hitting Britain, a spokesman for the British Army said. https://t.co/4CxpsSeCwx https://t.co/neKlXjqZDT

To fight climate change, companies and nonprofits have been promoting worldwide planting campaigns. Nearly everyone agrees that planting trees can be a useful activity. The problem is that, in practice, planting trees is more complicated than it sounds. https://t.co/6n02vCzpAM
Three people were killed at a mall in Greenwood, Indiana, on Sunday, in a shooting that ended when an armed man fatally shot the gunman, city authorities said. https://t.co/cSzAZ4gcwJ

"You’re not the worst person; you needn’t disappear into the ether. Rather, you are good and capable and quite possibly fine" “External self-talk,” as it’s clinically known, gets a bad rap. But it can be great for pushing through all sorts of obstacles. https://t.co/Z3h7XXImkA

Britain has declared a national emergency and issued its first-ever "red" warning for exceptional heat, meaning there is a potential risk to life with temperatures that could soar to 41 degrees Celsius (about 106 degrees Fahrenheit) on Monday and Tuesday. https://t.co/HiKvmb7ldZ

Breaking News: Three people were killed at a mall in Greenwood, Ind., in a mass shooting that ended when another armed individual fatally shot the gunman, city authorities said. https://t.co/1TVDwtaQiT

Relatives of people killed on 9/11 are urging Donald Trump to cancel a Saudi-backed golf tournament set to be held this month at Trump National Golf Club Bedminster in New Jersey. https://t.co/HSaHzDz8tC
